metadata.title: CVE-2017-7814 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
File downloads encoded with "blob:" and "data:" URL elements bypassednormal file download checks though the Phishing and Malware Protectionfeature and its block lists of suspicious sites and files. This would allowmalicious sites to lure users into downloading executables that wouldotherwise be detected as suspicious. This vulnerability affects Firefox <56, Firefox ESR < 52.4, and Thunderbird < 52.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7814` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
